Articles.Content: Are there any plans to add the Saturn V parts for KSP 2? More specifically the bottom fuel tank that makes it easy to mount the 5 engines. Hope it gets added in eventually.
This topic has been moved from KSP2 Discussion since it is a development suggestion.
Engine plates are for that. 4 symmetry, place on the bottom, plus one in the center.
I understand that, but the part flared out enough to allow for the Mastodon to fit on very naturally. With the engine plate, it doesn’t fit just right in my opinion

I haven't tried in KSP2 yet, but I agree, you can use an engine plate for that (granted, it might not be as visually pleasing if you're going for an authentic Saturn V look). Plus, that will be easier if they bring back the functionality to change the mounting style of the engines (shrouded | truss mount | bare). Mainly though, I think this will be easier if we can get better camera controls for the VAB (this is one of my big gripes, being unable to control camera height [vertical axis] and focus on different levels of the vessel).

11 hours ago, CashedOut said:

being unable to control camera height [vertical axis] and focus on different levels of the vessel).

Um, middle mouse click on part you want to focus on? Middle hold and mouse move to go up and down?

9 hours ago, The Aziz said:

Um, middle mouse click on part you want to focus on? Middle hold and mouse move to go up and down?

>facepalms< Still not used to having middle mouse functions
